oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Thompson Show (XELO) - Series 1, Program 6
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Hank Thompson radio show to promote his songbook on XELO, Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua, Mexico; advertised as and with a mailing address of Clint, Texas. Labelled as series 1, program 6. Likely original broadcast date of 1950-04-01 (unconfirmed). Backed by his Brazos Valley Boys of Wade Wood on fiddle (mentioned), Lefty Nason on steel guitar (mentioned) and Billy Stewart on bass (mentioned). Announcer at beginning referred to as Cousin Abner.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Thompson; Brazos Valley Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Announcer opening statement (Cousin Abner) -- Theme (Humpty Dumpty Heart) -- Give A Little, Take A Little -- Hank Thompson talks about his songbook -- Over The Waves (Wade Wood fiddle) -- I'll Sail My Ship Alone -- You Remembered Me -- Announcer talks about the Hank Thompson songbook -- Over Moonlit Waters (Lefty Nason steel guitar) -- Beautiful Life -- Closing statement -- Theme (Humpty Dumpty Heart) -- Announcer talks about the Hank Thompson songbook
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: XELO (Radio station : Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua, Mexico); Thompson, Hank; Brazos Valley Boys; Nason, Lefty; Wood, Wade; Stewart, Billy (Bassist)
